block.p: The perils of Internet auctions -- and the potential for fraud -- were highlighted when the price of a ''great, big, wild'' painting soared on eBay from 25 cents to $135,805 on speculation that it was by the artist Richard Diebenkorn. The seller, Kenneth A. Walton of Sacramento, later acknowledged that he had fabricated part of the story that described the work and had bid on the painting ''for a friend.'' EBay suspended him and voided the auction.
